meanings.definition: To repeat or prolong an action, thought, or utterance after the stimulus that prompted it has ceased.
meanings.sent1: She would perseverate on the same topic for hours, unable to move on.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes, when he gets anxious, he tends to perseverate on negative thoughts.
meanings.sent3: It's funny how she can perseverate on what to order at a restaurant for so long.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to perseverate on the mistake he made, unable to let it go.
meanings.sent5: The image of the accident would perseverate in his mind, haunting him.

meanings.definition: To continue a particular activity, state, or condition indefinitely.
meanings.sent1: The old clock would perseverate, ticking away in the silent room.
meanings.sent2: The rain seemed to perseverate, falling steadily throughout the day.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing how the toddler can perseverate on playing with the same toy for hours.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him would perseverate, never fading despite the passing years.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her smile would perseverate in his heart, bringing him comfort.
